input_text:
Job Title: Construction Inspector

Location: Dallas, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Description

Johnson, Mirmiran & Thompson is a dynamic, 100% employee-owned consulting firm of more than 2,000 professionals that provides a full range of multi-disciplined engineering, architecture, information technology, and related services to public agencies and private clients throughout the United States. JMT, is currently ranked #59 on Engineering News-Record’s list of the Top 500 Design Firms.

Position summary:  JMT's Facilities - CM Team is seeking a Construction Inspector for the Dallas, TX area. The successful candidate will apply standard inspection procedures to ongoing activities during and after construction for structural quality, general safety and conformance to plans, specifications and codes.

Essential Functions And Responsibilities

Review and interpret plans, site layouts, specifications and construction methods to ensure compliance to legal requirements and safety regulationsPerforms routine tests on concrete, soils and other materialsMeasure dimensions and verify level, alignment, and elevation of structures, fixtures, grades and/or pavement to ensure compliance to plans and codesCoordinate and supervise project inspection activities to ensure contractor compliance of plans, contract documents, specifications and standardsWork on behalf of the Client to draft project correspondence, facilitate project meetings, and resolve construction related field issuesGathers and maintains record documentsMakes field notes and computationsInteract with the general public, government agencies, contractors, sub-contractors, and other internal and external parties to respond to inquiriesReside in DFW, TX vicinity

Nonessential Functions And Responsibilities

Perform other related duties as assignedAbility to travel within the State on temporary basis if required by the project

Required Skills

Strong Computer proficiencyActive driver’s licenseAble to work throughout the State of Texas on a permanent basis

Required Experience

High school diploma or equivalent10+ years of Construction Inspection ExperienceClient requested certifications

Preferred Experience

Associates or bachelor’s degree in Construction Management or Civil EngineeringSupervisory experience in construction management/inspection situationsAbility to act in an Owner’s Agent/Responsible in Charge role

Working Conditions

Work is performed in the field. Ability to extensively perform bending, kneeling, standing, shoveling, and lifting and carrying objects weighing up to 25 lbs as needed. Work may be conducted outside in heat/cold, wet/humid, and dry/arid conditions.

JMT is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity, and we are proud to be building an inclusive and diverse workforce.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Construction Inspector
output_json.summary: Construction Inspector position at Johnson, Mirmiran & Thompson in Dallas, TX.
job_responsibilities: Review and interpret plans, site layouts, specifications, and construction methods to ensure compliance to legal requirements and safety regulations.
Performs routine tests on concrete, soils, and other materials.
Measure dimensions and verify level, alignment, and elevation of structures, fixtures, grades, and/or pavement to ensure compliance to plans and codes.
Coordinate and supervise project inspection activities to ensure contractor compliance of plans, contract documents, specifications, and standards.
Work on behalf of the Client to draft project correspondence, facilitate project meetings, and resolve construction-related field issues.
Interact with the general public, government agencies, contractors, sub-contractors, and other internal and external parties to respond to inquiries.
